passage.text: A simple method for generating full length cDNA from low abundance partial genomic clones

We have developed a simple, fast and easy way of generating cDNA clone from genomic sequences. The full-length HOXD13 recombination (1.1 kb) produced using this method was confirmed by sequence analysis. This simple approach can be used to generate fullâ€“length copies of available partial genomic sequencing.
The tight regulation of ribosome function is a consequence of the high energy consumption required for translation.
Our findings suggest that the translational machinery interacts with stop codon contexts in different ways, and they also suggest similarities between these mechanisms in readthrough and eukaryotes.
